topics: Tree, Depth-First Search, Breadth-First Search, Binary Tree
readme_description:
Given the roots of two binary trees `p` and `q`, write a function to check if they are the same or not.

Two binary trees are considered the same if they are structurally identical, and the nodes have the same value.
readme_constraints:
- The number of nodes in both trees is in the range [0, 100].
- -10^4 <= Node.val <= 10^4
helpers_run_signature: (solution_class: type, p_list: list[int | None], q_list: list[int | None])
helpers_run_body:
p = TreeNode[int].from_list(p_list)
    q = TreeNode[int].from_list(q_list)
    implementation = solution_class()
    return implementation.is_same_tree(p, q)
test_imports:
import pytest
from leetcode_py import logged_test
from .helpers import assert_is_same_tree, run_is_same_tree
from .solution import Solution

list.name: is_same_tree
list.signature: (self, p: TreeNode[int] | None, q: TreeNode[int] | None) -> bool

list.name: test_is_same_tree
list.signature: (self, p_list: list[int | None], q_list: list[int | None], expected: bool)
list.body:
result = run_is_same_tree(Solution, p_list, q_list)
        assert_is_same_tree(result, expected)

playground_imports:
from helpers import run_is_same_tree, assert_is_same_tree
from solution import Solution
from leetcode_py import TreeNode
playground_setup:
# Example test case
p_list: list[int | None] = [1, 2, 3]
q_list: list[int | None] = [1, 2, 3]
expected = True
